code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: shows a large focal hypermetabolic area on the right consistent with a 4.5 x4.2x 3.5 cm mass in the central portion of the right upper lobe, multiple other smaller hypermetabolic areas suggest lymph node metastatic disease in the chest, abdomen, and right supraclavicular region
shows a presence of a right upper lobe mass, along with mediastinal lymphadenopathy and multiple small pulmonary metastases
showed increased uptake in the proximal phalanx of right ring finger and likely metastatic deposits in T9 vertebrae and several ribs
showed moderately to poorly differentiated metastatic adenocarcinoma in keeping with lung origin

td.content: s:M cardiologist aged 59 ys presents with severe weight loss, mild shortness of breath, Cancer x 3 days. pt also reports chronic critical posterior thoracic pain on respiration. denies any smoking Patient reports that he never drinks alcohol o:Height 67 in, Weight 171 lbs, Temperature 98 F, Pulse 63, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 18, PET Scan Lung shows a large focal hypermetabolic area on the right consistent with a 4.5 x4.2x 3.5 cm mass in the central portion of the right upper lobe, multiple other smaller hypermetabolic areas suggest lymph node metastatic disease in the chest, abdomen, and right supraclavicular region a:Lung Cancer p:administered cisplatin - 60 mg/m2 3 times per month, irinotecan - 60 mg/m2 3 times per month, performed PET Scan Lung, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
